articles.author: Elaina Zachos
articles.title: This is How Camels Can Eat Spikey Cacti
articles.description: Hardened structures, called papillae, line the mouths of camels and other animals—including humans—to help them eat tough foods.

articles.author: Sarah Polger, Francis Rivera
articles.title: 21 Gorgeous Sunrise and Sunset Photos
articles.description: Chase the light around the world and see photos of cities and landscapes covered in golden hour hues.

articles.author: Richie Hertzberg
articles.title: Buffalo Gives the Horns to a Young Lion Cub
articles.description: After recently catching a lizard, a lion cub makes the mistake of taking its prize into buffalo territory.

articles.author: Sarah Gibbens
articles.title: New Hybrid Robot Uses Living Muscles to Move
articles.description: Researchers in Tokyo say they're a step closer to creating more complex and lifelike body parts made of living tissue and mechanical skeletons.

articles.author: Lori Cuthbert
articles.title: The Extraordinary Ways Weather Has Changed Human History
articles.description: From determining the outcome of wars to wholesale destruction of lives and property, weather affects our lives in a shocking number of ways.

articles.author: Elaina Zachos
articles.title: 5 Giant Salamander Species Identified—And They're All in Danger
articles.description: A new study shows that there are more species of Chinese giant salamander than previously thought, but most of those could go extinct in the near future.

articles.author: Kitson Jazynka
articles.title: Why Now is the Best Time to Visit the Great Pyramids
articles.description: Visit the Giza Plateau on summer solstice for an unusual view.

articles.author: Betsy Mason
articles.title: Explore Historic Mount Everest Expeditions Through National Geographic Maps
articles.description: Sixty-five years after the first climbers summited Mount Everest, we look back on our most stunning maps of the mountain.

articles.author: David Doubilet, Jennifer Hayes
articles.title: Behind the Scenes of a Close Crocodile Encounter
articles.description: A marine sanctuary teems with life, including a curious crocodile. A photographer has just seconds to decide: intervene or take a picture?

articles.author: Joel K. Bourne, Jr.
articles.title: This Refuge May Be the Most Contested Land in the U.S.
articles.description: Congress voted to open the Arctic National Wildlife Refuge to oil drilling. Here’s what’s at stake for America’s wild frontier.
